intro: Plectronia lycioides, commonly known as the false sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces yellowish or greenish flowers that are typically inconspicuous, and its leaves are usually fleshy and succulent. It thrives in arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. Plectronia lycioides is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
